TopicTitle: "King Tiger" Tiger II [WIP] - Expect a release soon, as in tomorrow

Articles.Content:
So, after some serious revisions to the Jadtiger design, I came up with the new Tiger-II. I'll release this first and then the Jadtiger.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/BFMzST5iHGQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

![ZuWwQpo.png](http://i.imgur.com/ZuWwQpo.png)

![BqZtCAH.png](http://i.imgur.com/BqZtCAH.png)

![53itrad.png](http://i.imgur.com/53itrad.png)

![gKQIdBy.png](http://i.imgur.com/gKQIdBy.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-06T07:29:41Z" title="07/06/2015 07:29  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 6, 2015</time> by andrew123**

Yop !

It seems to have enough agility to deal with the more heavy tank !

Looking nice ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

You never use Kerpaint to paint your job ? ( Maybe you don't like it )

> 
> Yop !
> It seems to have enough agility to deal with the more heavy tank !
> 
> Looking nice ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> 
> You never use Kerpaint to paint your job ? ( Maybe you don't like it )

Yeah, it's surprisingly more agile than my previous medium tank. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

And I just don't like kerbpaint due to the issues it historically faced with updates. Otherwise, I like to keep mods to a bare minimum. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
